introduction: Control systems are essential to a wide range of applications, including industrial processes,scientific instruments, and various business, social, and management issues. A solid understanding of the fundamental concepts underlying control systems is crucial for engineers and scientists. This virtual lab course offers practical experience with key control concepts in a simulated environment

experiments.name: Study the effect of addition of zeros to the forward path transfer function of a closed loop system
Study the effect of addition of poles to the forward path transfer function of a control system
To obtain root locus for a given transfer function of the system
To obtain bode plot for a given transfer function of the system
Nyquist plot of a second order system
To study the effect of PI, PD and PID controller on a control system

objective:
The primary goal of the Control Engineering Virtual Lab is to provide a foundational understanding of control system principles in a virtual setting. The objectives of the lab include
1. Understanding Control Concepts: Gain a basic understanding of control ideas and principles through interactive simulations and virtual experiments.
2. Component Characteristics: Study and verify the various characteristics of control system components using virtual tools.
3. System Development: Build a virtual control system and compute its transfer functionusing simulation software.
4. Stability Analysis: Analyze the stability of the developed virtual control system throughcomputational methods.

courseAlignment.description: The syllabi of this lab aligns to the following universities in India.
universities: Muffakham Jha College of Engineering & Technology, Hydrabad
AKTU Lucknow and Their Affiliated Colleges
Uttarakhand Technical University and Their Affiliated Colleges
